analyzed: drug pa'i lnga pa'i sa bon lnga pa'i dbyangs kyis nye bar mdzes pa stong pa'i lhas mnan pa /
translated: The seed syllable of the sixth [j] is beautified by the fifth vowel [u], stamped with the syllable of emptiness [ṃ].

original: de las de bzhin du skyes pa'i dpal ldan dkar po 'jam pa'i dbyangs gzhon nu zur phud lnga dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de las de bzhin du skyes pa'i dpal ldan dkar po 'jam pa'i dbyangs gzhon nu zur phud lnga dang ldan pa /
translated: From that, arisen in the same way, is the glorious white youthful Mañjughoṣa with five locks of hair.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa /🔽phyag gnyis pa g-yon na autpa la bsnams pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa / phyag gnyis pa g-yon na autpa la bsnams pa /
translated: He is adorned with all the ornaments.🔽In his left hand he holds a blue lotus.

original: g-yas pa rol pa'i stabs kyis seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
analyzed: g-yas pa rol pa'i stabs kyis seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs pa /
translated: With his right hand he makes the gesture of supreme generosity. He sits in the posture of a reclining lion on a lion throne.

original: bdag nyid gzhon nu'i skur bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gzhon nu'i skur bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should visualize oneself in the form of a youthful body.

original: 'di'i phyag rgya ni lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar nas mdzub mo dang ming med dag bkab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i phyag rgya ni lag pa gnyis thal mo sbyar nas mdzub mo dang ming med dag bkab pa'o //
translated: His mudrā is the two hands joined in añjali with the index finger and ring finger covering [the other fingers].

original: snying ga dang / mdzod spu dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bor dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: snying ga dang / mdzod spu dang / mgrin pa dang / spyi bor dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should place [the mudrās] at the heart, the point between the eyebrows, the throat, and the crown.
